SEARCH
Package fang2.sprites

Class ImageSprite

java.lang.Object
fang2.core.Sprite
fang2.sprites.ImageSprite
public class ImageSprite extends Sprite
This class takes an image and transforms it into a Sprite. This class contains some very complex operations. First, because loading and scaling images can be a time consuming operation, all images and scaled images are cached so that the operation needs to only occur once. However, the possibility exists for the cache to take up all of the available memory. Therefore, there is also the option for clearing the cache. This is typically done between game levels. All of the other sprites provided in the game engine are dynamically scaled using a transformation on the graphics object, however this transformation is removed before drawing the sprite. This class also contains more advanced image manipulations such as support for animated gifs, using images to fill shapes with or without repeating the image, flipping the image horizontally or vertically, and others.

  • Field Details

    • configuration

      public static GraphicsConfiguration configuration

  • Constructor Details

    • ImageSprite

      public ImageSprite(String filename)

    • ImageSprite

      public ImageSprite(String filename, boolean keepAspect)
      Creates a Sprite from an image file. The image file location is relative to the class constructing the ImageSprite. Like all Sprites, this one will start centered at (0, 0) and have unit width and height.
      Parameters:
      filename - the relative name of the image file
      keepAspect - whether the image should be resized to fit into a square or not. True indicates the original aspect of the image should be kept. False indicates the image should be resized to fit into a square.

    • ImageSprite

      public ImageSprite(URL url, boolean keepAspect)
      used internally for making duplicates
      Parameters:
      url - the image url
      keepAspect - true for keep the original aspect, false for make square

  • Method Details

    • normalize

      public void normalize()
      this method is deactivated and done manually when setting the shape within this class
      Overrides:
      normalize in class Sprite

    • clone

      public ImageSprite clone()
      gets a duplicate of this ImageSprite. Getting the duplicate does not add the duplicate to the canvas.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      a sprite with the same properties as the original sprite

      resets the image to another image
      Parameters:

    • setShape

      public void setShape(Shape shape)
      sets the shape of the image to display. This shape is intersected with the opaque part of the image.
      Overrides:
      setShape in class Sprite
      Parameters:
      shape - the new shape of the sprite

      flips the image along the horizontal axis before drawing it

    • setShear

      public void setShear(double x, double y)
      sets the shearing which has the effect of stretching the image. The shearing is done prior to the scaling and rotating.
      Parameters:
      x - the upper right shearing value
      y - the lower left shearing value

    • paint

      public void paint(Graphics2D brush)
      draws the image
      Overrides:
      paint in class Sprite
      Parameters:
      brush - the Graphics used to draw the shape

    • setImageIndex

      public void setImageIndex(int index)
      sets the index of the image which should be displayed. Setting this value to a negative number means the index should follow the animation sequence. The index must be less than the number of frames or an exception will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      index - the image to display

    • isLooping

      public boolean isLooping()
      determines if the animated gif loops back to the beginning once it reaches the end
      Returns:
      true if this is an animated gif and loops, false otherwise. The return value is always false for non-animated gifs.

    • setLooping

      public void setLooping(boolean looping)
      sets whether this animated image should loop or not. Calling this method on non-animated images has no effect and causes no error.
      Parameters:
      looping - true indicates the animation should begin again after reaching the end, false means it should stay at the last frame once the animation ends.

    • getImageIndex

      public int getImageIndex()
      gets the index of the sequence of images that should be displayed at this time
      Returns:
      the index to display

    • startAnimationNow

      public void startAnimationNow()
      sets now as the start time for the animation

    • fillToShapeSeamless

      public void fillToShapeSeamless()

    • fillToShape

      public void fillToShape()

    • setFill

      public void setFill(double scale)
      instead of drawing the image normal size, this method tiles the image at the given scale to fill the shape of this ImageSprite. The shape of ImageSprites by default is rectangular. A scale of less than 1 reverts back to drawing the image at normal size instead of tiling.
      Parameters:
      scale - the scale to tile the image at, less than 1 means no tiling

    • getFillPosition

      public Point2D.Double getFillPosition()
      gets the position at which to start tiling. (0, 0) is the default position.
      Returns:
      the position for tiling.

    • setFillPosition

      public void setFillPosition(Point2D.Double upperLeft)
      sets the position at which to start filling.
      Parameters:
      upperLeft - the upper left of where to fill. (0, 0) is the default.

    • setSeamlessFill

      public void setSeamlessFill(double scale)
      instead of drawing the image normal size, this method tiles the image at the given scale to fill the shape of this ImageSprite. Each tile in this fill represents the mirror image of the adjacent tiles so that the overall effect is seamless. The shape of ImageSprites by default is rectangular. A scale of less than 1 reverts back to drawing the image at normal size instead of tiling.
      Parameters:
      scale - the scale to tile the image at, less than 1 means no tiling

    • getFill

      public double getFill()
      gets the size of the tiling for the image, or -1 if the image is not tiled
      Returns:
      the scale of the tiling, or -1 if the image is not tiled

    • clearCache

      public static void clearCache()

    • getShape

      public Shape getShape(Image image)

    • getShape

      public Shape getShape(Image[] image, int index)
      Get the shape of the given image.
      Parameters:
      image - The array of images to build a path around.
      Returns:
      GeneralPath composed of the image with transparency removed
